response: REGDOC-1.4.1, Licence Application Guide: Class II Nuclear Facilities and Prescribed Equipment  43 The procedure should identify:  the timelines for implementing corrective actions when an action level has been exceeded  the feedback to be given to a worker who has exceeded an action level   the job title of the person responsible for notifying the CNSC within the time specified in the licence If action levels are not part of the applicant's radiation safety program, the applicant should demonstrate that measures are in place to ensure an equivalent level of safety. Exceeding an action level does not imply a regulatory non-compliance. However, failure to report when an action level has been exceeded is a violation of the Radiation Protection Regulations.
